fullText: Murad, Michael https://gedsh.bethmardutho.org/Murad-Michael http://syriaca.org/bibl/391 382 Michael Murad http://syriaca.org/person/644 person Priest, teacher, and lexicographer. (1878–1952) [ Syr. Cath. ] He was born in Mosul . He studied at the Seminary of St. John starting in 1893. He was ordained a priest in 1904 for Qaraqosh where he served for three years, after which he returned to Mosul and taught at the seminary. He composed an Arabic-Syriac lexicon. The lemmas until sīn were published (n.d.), with a 2nd ed. published under the title ktobo d-simto / Arabisk-Ass. / Syr. Ordbok (1984), with an introduction in Syriac and Swedish by Gabriel Isik. Sources Abūna, Adab , 551–2. Macuch, Geschichte , 437. George A. Kiraz
